<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: top" valign="top">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: separate" width="100%">
<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning and Happy New Year.</strong> You’re probably getting bombarded with New Year’s resolutions content (including later in this newsletter), so I might as well throw my two cents in—and by my two cents I mean sharing several frameworks from other people who actually think about this goal-setting stuff professionally.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">1. When we <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/icebreakers-withmaster-sommelier-ian-cauble?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interviewed</a> <em>Atomic Habits</em> author James Clear in September, he said that one of his ideas that most resonated with readers is “identity-based habits.” As Clear explained, “Rather than worrying about the results you want, focus on becoming the type of person who could achieve those results. So instead of worrying about losing 40 pounds, focus on being the kind of person who doesn’t miss workouts. Or rather than worrying about finishing the novel, focus on being the kind of person who writes every day.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">2. <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2022/jan/01/new-year-same-old-you-the-secret-to-self-improvement-is-embracing-your-messy-imperfect-life?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#comment-154002019" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This article</a> in the Guardian argues that the key to self-improvement is to ditch the concept of “reinvention” and accept yourself as imperfect—only once you no longer believe that you <em>must </em>transform into a “New You” are you able to make meaningful changes. The money quote comes from Zen teacher Shunryu Suzuki, who told his students, “Each of you is perfect just as you are—and you could all use improvement.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Hope these helped! See you tomorrow for the first standard-edition Brew of the new year.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>
</div>
</td>
</tr>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>

</a>
</h1>
<a style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/23/icebreakers-with-morning-brew-s-product-manager-ashna-mankotia?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class=""><img alt="Ashna Mankotia photo" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2771dbed286881a0c9c1fd6eab16bcc3b7040789-3971x2031.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">For last year’s New Year’s Day issue, we <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/morning-brew-product-manager-ashna-mankotia-shares-goalsetting-tips?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> Morning Brew product manager and goal-setting expert Ashna Mankotia for some tips on how to achieve personal growth in 2021. A lot has changed since then (Applebee’s is in the metaverse now!), so we decided to follow up with Ashna.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Looking back on your 2021 goals, how did you do? As a reminder, those goals included being able to do 75 pushups at once, reach 10k followers on TikTok, and reach 5k followers on Twitter.</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The way I set goals up, I can't fail at them completely. I make purposely ambiguous, high-level goals and then I develop metrics to measure them by. So did I check every single box? Honestly, no. But I did work toward everything, including my content creation. I didn't hit 75 pushups, but I just pulled that number out of thin air. I can do way more than I could at the beginning of the year. I never beat myself up for not hitting a certain goal or hitting a certain number.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>How did your goals change throughout the year?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I tried to be more conscious of the fact that it was a difficult year. At least where I am, in the Toronto area, the first half of this year was very locked down. So it was very easy to just focus on my fitness goals. And then in the second half of this year, Covid cases were going down, and there was more flexibility to travel and to do things. My fitness goals were no longer the main priority—my biggest priority was living my life.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">But I think goals exist to make our lives better, so I don’t think there’s anything wrong with changing a goal halfway through the year or just crossing it out completely. These are things you've created for yourself.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What types of goals do you think people should set?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I think everyone should set financial goals—they just matter so much. It’s important to think about your future and the lifestyle you want to live. When I was younger, like 18 or 20, I would just avoid looking at my credit card. I didn't get into investing until 2020.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So if I could make a goal for everyone, I would want people to feel like they can say, at the end of 2022, “I feel really financially literate.”</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What are some of your 2022 goals?</strong></p>
<ol style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>Improve strength: I definitely want to get to those 75 pushups.</span></li>
<li>
<span>Increase content creation: I want to hit 100k on </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@ohmygoshna?lang=en" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok</a></span><span> and monetize my TikTok.</span>
</li>
<li><span>Save to spend: I have a lot of weddings next year. I want to make sure I'm allocating my money and savings early on in the year, so in the summertime I'm not strained.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>
</div>

<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#353535!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/make-it-work-your-professional-new-year-s-resolutions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">Your Work New Year's Resolutions
</a>
</h1>
<a style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/make-it-work-your-professional-new-year-s-resolutions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class=""><img alt="Make it work image " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b6de1bb891bb0dd9e289abb0a591582a5da30e6-1503x603.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Each week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers a reader-submitted question about work in 2021. Anything bothering you at work? <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask Shane here</a>.</em></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">At the risk of reducing your workplace woes in 2022 (and thus jeopardizing my usefulness around here), we invited you last week to share your professional resolutions that you’re committed to accomplishing in the new year. Here are some responses that may spark ideas for your own 2022 playbook:</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Stop feeling guilty for taking time off.”—Kelly, CA</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Focus on one professional development area each month. Read a biz book, keep up with national news, improve soft and hard skill sets, ask more ‘why’ questions of my team.”— Alicia, Houston</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Own the problem and pick up the phone.”—Mike, Dallas</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Stop being available all hours of the day. Work and personal life has completely blurred since being 100% remote.”—Marie, Chicago</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Don’t continuously scan for emails all day. Dedicate time to read/respond so I can fully focus on other work.”—Jen, Brooklyn</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Review how the workweek went and plan the following week with small changes that can improve it.”—Diana, Portugal</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“Take 2–3 hours every Wednesday for a creative or restorative activity.”—Caitlin, Seattle</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">“I’m making a New Year’s resolution to stop procrastinating, but I think I’ll make it for <em>next</em> New Year’s.”—Jim, Maui</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">And a special thanks to those of you who shared your commitment to utilizing your standing desk more consistently this year; your resolutions (literally) brought me to my feet. And good luck to everyone who is resolving to bring self-improvement to the workplace. 2022 is going to be a good one.<br><br><em>Something bothering you at work? <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask Shane here</a>. And if you want to read more analysis about the workplace, make sure you <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/hr/subscribe?utm_campaign=hr_in_morningbrew_sundays&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=crosspromo&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subscribe to HR Brew</a>.</em></p>

<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#353535!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/what-will-2022-bring?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">What Will 2022 Bring?
</a>
</h1>
<a style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/what-will-2022-bring?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class=""><img alt="Woman wearing 2022 glasses " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/339f7856c26fb99779ae088d55d51a8554e62d21-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<span class="source" style="display:inline-block;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px"><small><em>ED JONES/AFP via Getty Images</em></small></span>
</a><div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Here is a (very) incomplete list of major events you should look out for this year.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>New regulations: </strong>A slew of new state laws are going into effect this year. The most notable? 26 states and Washington, DC, will raise their minimum wages (CA and parts of NY will bump it up to at least $15/hour). </p>
<ul style="line-height:22px"><li>
<span>Plus, a controversial new California law that requires more living space for breeding pigs and other livestock </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/californa-pork-bacon-animal-welfare-e803ac6750207c86370b025db4c284f2?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took effect</a></span><span> yesterday. Critics argue the new law will cause bacon prices to spike in CA—other researchers, however, have said any price increases would be modest.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Space: </strong>2021 was monumental for the space industry, from the James Webb telescope launch to Jeff Bezos spraying an emotional William Shatner with champagne. But 2022 <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/12/27/space-events-in-2022/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could top it</a>.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>NASA is launching two extremely powerful rockets as part of its goal to send astronauts back to the moon in 2025.</span></li>
<li><span>SpaceX could launch its Starship rocket into orbit. It’s the reusable spacecraft that will ferry NASA astronauts from their capsule to the lunar surface and enable SpaceX's Mars ambitions.</span></li>
<li><span>Blue Origin, SpaceX, and Virgin Galactic will ramp up their space tourism efforts by selling more joyrides to wealthy people. Virgin is hoping to begin commercial service this year.</span></li>
<li>
<span>This </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rqdmpuwOw7g" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cool-looking space plane</a></span><span>, Sierra Space’s Dream Chaser, could send cargo to the International Space Station.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Sports: </strong>2022 will give us two big international sporting events.</p>
<ol style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>Beijing will become the first city to host both a Winter and Summer Olympics when the Winter games kick off there in February. The US and some of its allies aren’t sending diplomats to the competition to protest the Chinese government’s human rights abuses.</span></li>
<li><span>The World Cup will oddly take place in November—because it’d be way too hot to play soccer in host country Qatar during the summer. Many critics have taken exception to Qatar hosting; the Gulf state has been accused of mistreating migrant workers who built the soccer stadiums and of bribing FIFA officials to secure the hosting rights in the first place.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Streaming: </strong>Netflix will look to rev up last year’s sluggish growth with <a href="https://variety.com/vip/the-top-20-most-anticipated-streaming-titles-of-2022-1235144571/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new seasons</a> of its biggest hits, including <em>Stranger Things</em>, <em>Bridgerton</em>, and <em>The Crown</em>. HBO will try to redeem the unredeemable—Season 8 of <em>Game of Thrones</em>—with a prequel, <em>House of the Dragon</em>. Amazon Prime Video will release its highly anticipated and uber-expensive <em>Lord of the Rings </em>series, while Disney+ will supply us with more Marvel and Star Wars content we’ve been so starved of.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Music: </strong>One of the highlights of the year in music will definitely be ABBA’s <em>Voyage</em> concert in May, where the Swedish pop legends will perform in a purpose-built London arena using digital avatars. <a href="https://variety.com/2021/music/news/abba-voyage-virtual-concert-1235078140/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Good luck</a> finding tickets.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>We will also hopefully see the return of festivals like Burning Man and Coachella, which have been canceled for the previous two years.</span></li>
<li><span>Some notable album releases: Lizzo, Mitksi, The Weeknd, Avril Lavigne (!), and possibly Kendrick Lamar.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Global politics: </strong>South Korea, France, Hungary, the Philippines, and Brazil are among the countries <a href="https://www.cfr.org/blog/ten-elections-watch-2022?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">holding pivotal elections</a> this year. The US midterms will take place in November.</p>
</div>

</a>
</h1>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that didn’t set any resolutions and is just hoping to coast this year. We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.</p>
<img class="img-responsive" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-12-24/image-84e7fc539f5eaf620e061c783a93f038199a8751-1200x594-gif/utah.gif" alt="St George, Utah home on a cliff." style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display:block;width:100% !important"><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px"><small><em><em>Zillow</em></em></small></span><p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Today’s <a href="https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/3052-N-Snow-Canyon-Pkwy-UNIT-218-Saint-George-UT-84770/335618767_zpid/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">home</a> sits right up against Red Cliffs National Conservation area in the booming city of St. George, Utah, about an hour west of Zion National Park. This 3,447 square-foot new build sits on a cul de sac so you never have to worry about your neighbors putting up a bouncy castle and obstructing your beautiful view. Amenities include:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>3 beds, 4 baths</span></li>
<li><span>Whole lotta rocks</span></li>
<li><span>4-car attached garage</span></li>
<li><span>Tetris-like floor plan</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much for cliffside living? </p>
</div>

</a>
</h1>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">1. Rescuing a Jeep from a pretty dire situation. (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ye-83guWJw" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Matt’s Off Road Recovery</a>)<br>2. It’s hard to live with some objects, and even harder to get rid of them. (<a href="https://reallifemag.com/unwanted-corkpull/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Real Life</a>)<br>3. Betty White improvising. #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning and Happy New Year.\u003c/strong\u003e You’re probably getting bombarded with New Year’s resolutions content (including later in this newsletter), so I might as well throw my two cents in—and by my two cents I mean sharing several frameworks from other people who actually think about this goal-setting stuff professionally.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e1. When we \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/03/icebreakers-withmaster-sommelier-ian-cauble?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterviewed\u003c/a\u003e \u003cem\u003eAtomic Habits\u003c/em\u003e author James Clear in September, he said that one of his ideas that most resonated with readers is “identity-based habits.” As Clear explained, “Rather than worrying about the results you want, focus on becoming the type of person who could achieve those results. So instead of worrying about losing 40 pounds, focus on being the kind of person who doesn’t miss workouts. Or rather than worrying about finishing the novel, focus on being the kind of person who writes every day.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e2. \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2022/jan/01/new-year-same-old-you-the-secret-to-self-improvement-is-embracing-your-messy-imperfect-life?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew#comment-154002019\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThis article\u003c/a\u003e in the Guardian argues that the key to self-improvement is to ditch the concept of “reinvention” and accept yourself as imperfect—only once you no longer believe that you \u003cem\u003emust \u003c/em\u003etransform into a “New You” are you able to make meaningful changes. The money quote comes from Zen teacher Shunryu Suzuki, who told his students, “Each of you is perfect just as you are—and you could all use improvement.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHope these helped! border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/23/icebreakers-with-morning-brew-s-product-manager-ashna-mankotia?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Ashna Mankotia photo\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2771dbed286881a0c9c1fd6eab16bcc3b7040789-3971x2031.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFor last year’s New Year’s Day issue, we \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/30/morning-brew-product-manager-ashna-mankotia-shares-goalsetting-tips?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e Morning Brew product manager and goal-setting expert Ashna Mankotia for some tips on how to achieve personal growth in 2021. A lot has changed since then (Applebee’s is in the metaverse now!), so we decided to follow up with Ashna.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLooking back on your 2021 goals, how did you do? As a reminder, those goals included being able to do 75 pushups at once, reach 10k followers on TikTok, and reach 5k followers on Twitter.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe way I set goals up, I can't fail at them completely. I make purposely ambiguous, high-level goals and then I develop metrics to measure them by. So did I check every single box? Honestly, no. But I did work toward everything, including my content creation. I didn't hit 75 pushups, but I just pulled that number out of thin air. I can do way more than I could at the beginning of the year. I never beat myself up for not hitting a certain goal or hitting a certain number.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow did your goals change throughout the year?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI tried to be more conscious of the fact that it was a difficult year. At least where I am, in the Toronto area, the first half of this year was very locked down. So it was very easy to just focus on my fitness goals. And then in the second half of this year, Covid cases were going down, and there was more flexibility to travel and to do things. My fitness goals were no longer the main priority—my biggest priority was living my life.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBut I think goals exist to make our lives better, so I don’t think there’s anything wrong with changing a goal halfway through the year or just crossing it out completely. These are things you've created for yourself.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat types of goals do you think people should set?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI think everyone should set financial goals—they just matter so much. It’s important to think about your future and the lifestyle you want to live. When I was younger, like 18 or 20, I would just avoid looking at my credit card. I didn't get into investing until 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSo if I could make a goal for everyone, I would want people to feel like they can say, at the end of 2022, “I feel really financially literate.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are some of your 2022 goals?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eImprove strength: I definitely want to get to those 75 pushups.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIncrease content creation: I want to hit 100k on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@ohmygoshna?lang=en\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTikTok\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and monetize my TikTok.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSave to spend: I have a lot of weddings next year. I want to make sure I'm allocating my money and savings early on in the year, so in the summertime I'm not strained.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/23/icebreakers-with-morning-brew-s-product-manager-ashna-mankotia\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/make-it-work-your-professional-new-year-s-resolutions?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Make it work image \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b6de1bb891bb0dd9e289abb0a591582a5da30e6-1503x603.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEach week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers a reader-submitted question about work in 2021. Anything bothering you at work? \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsk Shane here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAt the risk of reducing your workplace woes in 2022 (and thus jeopardizing my usefulness around here), we invited you last week to share your professional resolutions that you’re committed to accomplishing in the new year. Here are some responses that may spark ideas for your own 2022 playbook:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Stop feeling guilty for taking time off.”—Kelly, CA\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Focus on one professional development area each month. Read a biz book, keep up with national news, improve soft and hard skill sets, ask more ‘why’ questions of my team.”— Alicia, Houston\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Own the problem and pick up the phone.”—Mike, Dallas\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Stop being available all hours of the day. Work and personal life has completely blurred since being 100% remote.”—Marie, Chicago\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Don’t continuously scan for emails all day. Dedicate time to read/respond so I can fully focus on other work.”—Jen, Brooklyn\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Review how the workweek went and plan the following week with small changes that can improve it.”—Diana, Portugal\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“Take 2–3 hours every Wednesday for a creative or restorative activity.”—Caitlin, Seattle\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e“I’m making a New Year’s resolution to stop procrastinating, but I think I’ll make it for \u003cem\u003enext\u003c/em\u003e New Year’s.”—Jim, Maui\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAnd a special thanks to those of you who shared your commitment to utilizing your standing desk more consistently this year; your resolutions (literally) brought me to my feet. And good luck to everyone who is resolving to bring self-improvement to the workplace. 2022 is going to be a good one.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eSomething bothering you at work? \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsk Shane here\u003c/a\u003e. border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/what-will-2022-bring?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"Woman wearing 2022 glasses \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/339f7856c26fb99779ae088d55d51a8554e62d21-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eED JONES/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eHere is a (very) incomplete list of major events you should look out for this year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew regulations: \u003c/strong\u003eA slew of new state laws are going into effect this year. The most notable? 26 states and Washington, DC, will raise their minimum wages (CA and parts of NY will bump it up to at least $15/hour). \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, a controversial new California law that requires more living space for breeding pigs and other livestock \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/californa-pork-bacon-animal-welfare-e803ac6750207c86370b025db4c284f2?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etook effect\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday. Critics argue the new law will cause bacon prices to spike in CA—other researchers, however, have said any price increases would be modest.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSpace: \u003c/strong\u003e2021 was monumental for the space industry, from the James Webb telescope launch to Jeff Bezos spraying an emotional William Shatner with champagne. But 2022 \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/12/27/space-events-in-2022/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould top it\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNASA is launching two extremely powerful rockets as part of its goal to send astronauts back to the moon in 2025.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpaceX could launch its Starship rocket into orbit. It’s the reusable spacecraft that will ferry NASA astronauts from their capsule to the lunar surface and enable SpaceX's Mars ambitions.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlue Origin, SpaceX, and Virgin Galactic will ramp up their space tourism efforts by selling more joyrides to wealthy people. Virgin is hoping to begin commercial service this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rqdmpuwOw7g\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecool-looking space plane\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Sierra Space’s Dream Chaser, could send cargo to the International Space Station.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSports: \u003c/strong\u003e2022 will give us two big international sporting events.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeijing will become the first city to host both a Winter and Summer Olympics when the Winter games kick off there in February. The US and some of its allies aren’t sending diplomats to the competition to protest the Chinese government’s human rights abuses.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe World Cup will oddly take place in November—because it’d be way too hot to play soccer in host country Qatar during the summer. Many critics have taken exception to Qatar hosting; the Gulf state has been accused of mistreating migrant workers who built the soccer stadiums and of bribing FIFA officials to secure the hosting rights in the first place.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStreaming: \u003c/strong\u003eNetflix will look to rev up last year’s sluggish growth with \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/vip/the-top-20-most-anticipated-streaming-titles-of-2022-1235144571/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew seasons\u003c/a\u003e of its biggest hits, including \u003cem\u003eStranger Things\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eBridgerton\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e. HBO will try to redeem the unredeemable—Season 8 of \u003cem\u003eGame of Thrones\u003c/em\u003e—with a prequel, \u003cem\u003eHouse of the Dragon\u003c/em\u003e. Amazon Prime Video will release its highly anticipated and uber-expensive \u003cem\u003eLord of the Rings \u003c/em\u003eseries, while Disney+ will supply us with more Marvel and Star Wars content we’ve been so starved of.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMusic: \u003c/strong\u003eOne of the highlights of the year in music will definitely be ABBA’s \u003cem\u003eVoyage\u003c/em\u003e concert in May, where the Swedish pop legends will perform in a purpose-built London arena using digital avatars. \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/music/news/abba-voyage-virtual-concert-1235078140/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGood luck\u003c/a\u003e finding tickets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe will also hopefully see the return of festivals like Burning Man and Coachella, which have been canceled for the previous two years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome notable album releases: Lizzo, Mitksi, The Weeknd, Avril Lavigne (!), and possibly Kendrick Lamar.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGlobal politics: \u003c/strong\u003eSouth Korea, France, Hungary, the Philippines, and Brazil are among the countries \u003ca href=\"https://www.cfr.org/blog/ten-elections-watch-2022?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eholding pivotal elections\u003c/a\u003e this year. The US midterms will take place in November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/01/what-will-2022-bring\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
